==German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|de|steh'n}} * {{l|de|stehn}} {{qualifier|dated in formal prose, but still common informally or poetically}} ===Etymology=== {{PIE root|de|steh₂}} From {{inh|de|goh|stān}}, {{m|goh|stēn}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*stāną}}. The ''-h-'' was introduced into the spelling by analogy with {{m|de|sehen}}, in which it had become mute but was retained in spelling. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈʃteː.ən/}} {{a|official standard, but less common}} * {{IPA|de|/ʃteːn/}} {{a|predominant}} * {{hyphenation|de|ste|hen}} * {{audio|de|De-stehen.ogg|Audio}} * {{audio|de|De-at-stehen.ogg|audio (Austria)}} * {{rhymes|de|eːən|eːn}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-irregular|steht|stand|gestanden|auxiliary=both|past subjunctive=[[stände]] or [[stünde]]}} # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[stand]] (to be upright, support oneself on the feet in an erect position) # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[be]], to [[appear]], to [[stand]] (to be placed or located somewhere) #: {{ux|de|Das '''steht''' nicht in dem Wörterbuch.|This does not '''appear''' in the dictionary.}} #* '''1931''', {{w|Arthur Schnitzler}}, ''[[s:de:Flucht in die Finsternis|Flucht in die Finsternis]]'', {{w|S. Fischer Verlag}}, page 36: #*: Ein frisch gefülltes Glas Champagner '''stand''' vor ihm. Er trank es in einem Zug aus – mit Lust, fast mit Begier. #*:: A freshly filled glass of champaign was in front of him. He emptied it in one draught – with pleasure, almost with greed. # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[stay]]; to be [[still]] # {{lb|de|Swiss}} to [[confront]], [[surrender]] #: {{syn|de|[[stellen|sich stellen]]}} ====Usage notes==== The most frequent auxiliary with ''stehen'' is {{m|de|haben}}: ''Ich habe gestanden.'' (NB: This expression also happens to be the perfect tense of {{m|de|gestehen}}: ''I have confessed.'') In northern and central Germany, only this form is used. In southern Germany, Austria, and Switzerland, {{m|de|sein}} is common in the vernacular and also, alternatively, in standard usage: ''Ich bin gestanden.'' ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-irr-stehen|aux=hs}} ====Derived terms==== {{der-top}} * {{l|de|abstehen}} * {{l|de|anstehen}} * {{l|de|aufstehen}} * {{l|de|ausstehen}} * {{l|de|beistehen}} * {{l|de|bestehen}} * {{l|de|darüberstehen}} * {{l|de|darunterstehen}} * {{l|de|dastehen}} * {{l|de|durchstehen}} * {{l|de|einstehen}} {{der-mid}} * {{l|de|entstehen}} * {{l|de|erstehen}} * {{l|de|feststehen}} * {{l|de|gestehen}} * {{l|de|seinen Mann stehen}} * {{l|de|überstehen}} * {{l|de|unterstehen}} * {{l|de|verstehen}} * {{l|de|vorstehen}} * {{l|de|widerstehen}} * {{l|de|zustehen}} {{der-bottom}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
